resources.string: You can perform any outdoor activities.
For people who are sensitive to contamination: consider limiting prolonged outdoor efforts.
Kids, older adults, people who are doing intense physical activities or who have breathing or heart problems: limit prolonged outdoor efforts.
Kids, older adults, people who are doing intense physical activities or who have breathing or heart problems: avoid prolonged outdoor efforts.
General population: abstain from any outdoor efforts.
Coarse dust particles are 2.5 to 10 micrometers in diameter. Sources include crushing or grinding operations and dust.
Fine particles are 2.5 micrometers in diameter or smaller. They are produced from all types of combustion.
Natural gas composed of three atoms of oxygen.
If air quality is bad, avoid spending prolonged periods outdoors.
If air quality is bad, keep windows and doors closed
If air quality is bad, do not practice exercise outdoors.
If air quality is bad, people with allergies, especially asthma, should stay indoors.
If air quality is bad, people who smoke any kind of tobacco should abstain from doing so.
If air quality is bad, people with a history of heart problems should stay indoors or in low risk zones.
If air quality is bad, people who use fuel, like cooks, should abstain from doing so until air quality improves.
If air quality is bad, vehicle use should be reduced as much as possible.
